title: High Net Secondary Income
description: In 2023, India recorded a net secondary income of $101.9 billion, showcasing strong remittance inflows from abroad.

title: Political Stability Concerns
description: India's political stability in 2023 was measured with a standard error of 0.205, indicating potential volatility in governance.

title: Low Community Health Worker Density
description: As of 2016, India had only 0.581 community health workers per 1,000 people, highlighting a need for more healthcare professionals.

title: High Prevalence of Low-Birthweight Babies
description: In 2020, 27.4% of births in India were low-birthweight, indicating significant challenges in maternal and child health.

title: High Prevalence of Child Wasting
description: In 2020, 18.7% of children under 5 in India were affected by wasting, a critical indicator of malnutrition.

title: Severe Child Wasting Issues
description: In 2020, 7.5% of children under 5 in India suffered from severe wasting, reflecting acute malnutrition challenges.

title: Income Inequality Challenges
description: In 2022, the lowest 10% of India's population held only 4.5% of the income, indicating significant income disparity.

title: Efficient Remittance Costs
description: In 2023, India had an average remittance transaction cost of 0.54%, one of the lowest globally, benefiting overseas workers.
